SENT.plain: A case of cerebral lipiodol embolism after transcatheter arterial chemoembolization (TACE) of hepatocellular carcinoma is presented
A 76-year-old man underwent TACE for advanced hepatocellular carcinoma
Immediately after chemoembolization, his level of consciousness deteriorated
Computed tomography revealed deposition of iodized oil in the cerebral cortex, basal ganglia, and thalami
Magnetic resonance imaging showed restricted diffusion within the thalami and basal ganglia
The patient's level of consciousness gradually improved, and all neurologic symptoms disappeared over 6 weeks
